required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Diagnosis and Prognosis of Nonpalpable Breast Cancer Detected by the US vs Mammography: a Clinical Noninferiority Trial.
clinical_study.official_title: The Diagnosis and Prognosis of Nonpalpable Breast Cancer Detected by the Ultrasound vs Mammography: a Clinical Noninferiority Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of the Fourth Military Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of the Fourth Military Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate and compare the sensitivity, specificity, AUC, pathology results of core needle biopsy and surgical pathology results coincidence rate, tumor staging, and DFS (disease-free survival) of US-detected nonpalpable breast cancer vs mammography-detected nonpalpable breast cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of corrected-detected malignant lesions by the US or MG
Proportion of corrected-detected benign lesions by the US or MG
Area under receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve in percentage (%)
The time that the patient is free of the signs and symptoms of a disease after treatment.

arm_group.description: the lesion could detected by mammography
the lesion could detected by breast ulrtasound

study_pop.textblock: Female patients over 18 years old from China

overall_official.affiliation: Xijing hospital of The fourth military medical university

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Fourth Military Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of the Fourth Military Medical University
